title: Southwest Chicken Salad Recipe
description: This bold grilled chicken salad with a fresh lime-avocado-ranch dressing brings all the Southwest flavor.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes BBQ & Grilling Chicken Salads Southwest Chicken Salad 4.7 (3) 3 Reviews 3 Photos Romaine is topped with grilled chicken, corn, beans, tomatoes, and onions, and drizzled with a creamy avocado ranch dressing. This is one hearty salad that hits the spot all year around. Submitted by Soup Loving Nicole Published on February 10, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 3 3 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 2 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 2 servings 1 avocado - peeled, pitted, and chopped ¼ cup sour cream 1 tablespoon mayonnaise 1 tablespoon water 2 tablespoons freshly squeezed lime juice ½ (1 ounce) packet ranch dressing mix ½ teaspoon salt 2 (6 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breast halves 1 tablespoon olive oil 1 ½ tablespoons fajita seasoning 1 medium ear corn, husk and silk removed 1 medium head romaine lettuce, chopped ½ cup halved grape tomatoes 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained ½ small red onion, sliced into petals Directions Combine avocado, sour cream, mayonnaise, water, lime juice, ranch seasoning, and salt in a food processor. Blend until smooth. Refrigerate until ready to use. Place the chicken in a bowl. Add olive oil and fajita seasoning. Toss until evenly combined. Prepare a grill over medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate. Add chicken and corn. Grill, turning once, until corn is tender and chicken is no longer pink in the center and juices run clear, about 10 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted near the center should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Transfer to a cutting board. Divide romaine, tomatoes, black beans, and onions between two serving plates. Cut corn off the cob; divide between the two plates. Slice chicken breast; divide between the 2 plates. Drizzle each salad with avocado dressing to serve. I Made It Print Nutrition Facts (per serving) 827 Calories 37g Fat 71g Carbs 59g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 2 Calories 827 % Daily Value * Total Fat 37g 47% Saturated Fat 9g 43% Cholesterol 114mg 38% Sodium 2305mg 100% Total Carbohydrate 71g 26% Dietary Fiber 27g 96% Protein 59g 118% Potassium 2317mg 49% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Southwest Chicken Salad 01 of 03 Photo by  Soup Loving Nicole 02 of 03 Photo by  CindyCan'tCook 11/08/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow This recipe was quick, easy, and delicious. I didn't do anything different than what it calls for, other than I added a little shredded cheddar and cilantro to the top because hubs thinks a salad for dinner should have cheese LOL. I also added a little fresh cilantro into the food processor with the dressing just because we love it! This is a definite keeper and I'll be making it again! 03 of 03 Photo by  Lela 09/23/2024 A keeper! My husband and I loved this recipe. I would say my favorite part of the recipe was the creamy avocado ranch dressing. I did have to add more water to thin out the salad dressing as it was too thick even to spoon on the dressing. 1 You’ll Also Love Chicken Bacon Ranch Salad 1 Rating Chicken, Avocado and Mango Salad 94 Ratings Grilled Bang Bang Chicken Salad Cherry Chicken Salad 113 Ratings The Cheesecake Factory Santa Fe Salad 4 Ratings Dill Chicken Salad 18 Ratings Easy Buffalo Chicken Salad Southwest Chicken Power Salad Grilled Chicken Salad with Strawberries and Avocado 2 Ratings Peruvian Potato-Chicken Salad (Causa Rellena) 8 Ratings Horseradish-Cheddar Chicken Salad 8 Ratings Chicken Noodle Salad 33 Ratings Tropical Grilled Chicken Breast 58 Ratings Mediterranean Chicken and Orzo Salad In Red Pepper Cups 48 Ratings Hawaiian Chicken Pineapple Kabobs 798 Ratings Amy's Barbecue Chicken Salad 325 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Soup Loving Nicole
instructions: Combine avocado, sour cream, mayonnaise, water, lime juice, ranch seasoning, and salt in a food processor. Blend until smooth. Refrigerate until ready to use.;Place the chicken in a bowl. Add olive oil and fajita seasoning. Toss until evenly combined.;Prepare a grill over medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate. Add chicken and corn. Grill, turning once, until corn is tender and chicken is no longer pink in the center and juices run clear, about 10 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted near the center should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Transfer to a cutting board.;Divide romaine, tomatoes, black beans, and onions between two serving plates. Cut corn off the cob; divide between the two plates.;Slice chicken breast; divide between the 2 plates. Drizzle each salad with avocado dressing to serve.
